intro: Trichoscypha nigra, commonly known as the black ivory nut, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain hard, black seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a source of oil. Trichoscypha nigra is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and swampy areas. Its ecological importance includes providing food for various wildlife species and contributing to soil stabilization in its native environment.
